item.title: MATE 1.28 Released
item.description:
We are pleased to announce the release of MATE Desktop 1.28. This release brings many improvements and bug fixes.

Highlights

Wayland Progress

MATE 1.28 continues our work towards Wayland support. While we still recommend X11 for production use, significant progress has been made:

  • Improved compatibility with Wayland compositors
  • Updated libraries for better Wayland integration
  • Testing infrastructure improvements

Core Improvements

  • Caja: Enhanced file operations and better performance with large directories
  • Marco: Window manager improvements and better compositing
  • MATE Panel: New applet features and stability fixes
  • Control Center: Updated settings dialogs and better hardware support

Accessibility

  • Improved screen reader compatibility
  • Better high contrast theme support
  • Enhanced keyboard navigation throughout the desktop

Under the Hood

  • Updated to latest GTK3 features
  • Improved memory management
  • Better systemd integration
  • Security hardening across all components

Download

MATE 1.28 is available in the repositories of most major distributions:

  • Ubuntu MATE 24.04 - Ships with MATE 1.28
  • Fedora 40 - Available in official repos
  • Debian Testing - Available now
  • Arch Linux - Available in [extra]

Thanks

Thank you to all contributors who made this release possible! Special thanks to our translators, packagers, and everyone who reported bugs and tested pre-releases.

Get Involved

Want to help with MATE development? Visit our GitHub to get started!

item.title: Welcome to Our New Website
item.description:
We’re excited to launch our redesigned website! The new site is built with Hugo and provides faster loading times and improved documentation.

What’s New

Modern Design

The new website features a clean, modern design that’s easy to navigate while maintaining the classic feel that MATE users appreciate.

Improved Documentation

We’ve reorganized and expanded our documentation to help both new and experienced users:

  • Getting Started Guide - For users new to MATE
  • Installation Instructions - Distribution-specific instructions
  • Configuration Guide - Customize your desktop
  • Application Documentation - Learn about MATE apps

Better Performance

The new site is static, meaning it loads faster and uses fewer resources. Just like MATE itself, we believe in efficiency!

Mobile Friendly

The responsive design ensures the site works well on phones and tablets, making it easy to look up information on any device.

Contributing

The website source is available on GitHub. We welcome contributions:

  • Fix typos and improve documentation
  • Translate content to your language
  • Suggest improvements

Feedback

We’d love to hear your thoughts on the new website. Join us on IRC (#mate on libera.chat) or Matrix to share your feedback.

Thank you for being part of the MATE community!
